revisions.rev:
{{Infobox company |name=CloudFlare |logo=[[File:CloudFlareLogo.png|185px]] |caption= |foundation={{Start date|2009|07}} |founder=Matthew Prince
Lee Holloway
Michelle Zatlyn |location_city=[[San Francisco, CA]] |location_country=[[United States]] |key_people=Matthew Prince ([[CEO]])
Lee Holloway
Michelle Zatlyn |industry=Internet |products=CloudFlare |services=Website performance and security |homepage={{URL|cloudflare.com}} }} '''CloudFlare''' is a [[content delivery network]] and distributed [[Domain Name Server]] service aimed at enhancing website performance and speed and providing security. CloudFlare offers both free and paid services. CloudFlare gained media attention after providing security to [[LulzSec]]'s website.{{cite web |url=http://allthingsd.com/20110610/web-security-start-up-cloudflare-gets-buzz-courtesy-of-lulzsec-hackers/ |title=Web Security Start-Up Cloudflare Gets Buzz, Courtesy of LulzSec Hackers |first=Arik |last=Hesseldahl |date=2011-06-10 |work=[[All Things Digital]] |publisher= |accessdate=2011-08-15}}{{cite web |url=http://www.thewhir.com/web-hosting-news/061711_CloudFlare_Gets_an_Unusual_Endorsement_from_Hacker_Group_LulzSec |title=CloudFlare Gets an Unusual Endorsement from Hacker Group LulzSec |first=Nicole |last=Henderson |date=2011-06-17 |work=Webhost Industry Review |publisher= |accessdate=2011-08-15}} The Turkish government also utilizes CloudFlare technology. Matthew Prince, Lee Holloway, and Michelle Zatlyn created CloudFlare in 2009.{{cite web |url=https://www.cloudflare.com/our-story.html |title=Our story |author= |date= |work= |publisher=CloudFlare |accessdate=2011-08-15}} Matthew Prince and Lee Holloway previously worked on [[Project Honey Pot]].{{cite web |url=http://www.projecthoneypot.org/cloudflare_beta.html |title=CloudFlare Beta |author= |date= |work= |publisher=Project Honey Pot |accessdate=2011-08-15}} CloudFlare was launched at September 2010 TechCrunch Disrupt conference. The [[World Economic Forum]] (WEF) praised CloudFlare's "innovative algorithms" and its ability to adapt in its "Technology Pioneers 2012" report.{{cite web |url=http://www.weforum.org/reports/technology-pioneers-2012 |title=Technology Pioneers 2012 |author= |date=2011-09 |work= |publisher=World Economic Forum |page=8 |accessdate=2011-09-06}} The WEF called LulzSec's use of CloudFlare's services "a vote of confidence in CloudFlare's approach."{{cite web |url=http://arstechnica.com/tech-policy/news/2011/09/cloudflare-named-tech-pioneer-after-protecting-lulzsec-website.ars |title=CloudFlare named "tech pioneer" after protecting LulzSec website |first=Nate |last=Anderson |date=2011-09-01 |work=[[Ars Technica]] |publisher= |accessdate=2011-09-08}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[https://www.cloudflare.com/ CloudFlare] {{Tech-stub}} [[Category:Companies based in San Francisco, California]] [[Category:Internet companies of the United States]]
